messages.content:
Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
electrical iout_p, iout_n, iin_x, iin_n; Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
   initial Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

corrected code：
   analog

 Correction Criteria：Replaced 'analog' with 'initial', converting the continuous-time current contribution into a one-time initialization statement. This breaks the fundamental behavior of the current controlled current source, as the output current no longer dynamically responds to input current changes during simulation.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
I(iout_n, iout_p) <+ gain*I(iin_p, iin_n); Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
module cccs_hdl(iout_n, iout_p, iin_p, iin_n); Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
I(iout_p, iout_n) <+ gain*V(iin_p, iin_n); Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
I(iout_p, iout_n) <+ gain*I(iin_n, iin_p); Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
module cccs_hdl(iout_p, iout_n, iin_p, iin_m); Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
   analog initial Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

corrected code：
   analog

 Correction Criteria：Replacing 'analog' with 'analog initial' restricts the current source calculation to time zero only. This violates continuous behavior requirements as the controlled current won't update during simulation, causing incorrect DC/transient results.

   analg Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

corrected code：
   analog

 Correction Criteria：Misspelled keyword 'analg' instead of 'analog', causing unrecognized block declaration syntax error

corrected code：
   analog

 Correction Criteria：Missing 'end' keyword for the analog block. Added 'begin' without corresponding 'end', causing unterminated block structure.

   analog begin Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

corrected code：
   analog

 Correction Criteria：Added 'begin' without corresponding 'end', causing unterminated block structure since the following statement isn't properly enclosed and the module ends without closing the analog block.
